text: <@U1AJV5S2G>: great news. But I didn't get if you have a recipe on how to build on Win7...

<@U0ZR63HLK>, I did not need to run as admin, I did not need to upgrade npm or node, and I did nto neeed to install node-pre-gyp.   Ratnakar had me delete my fabric directory and reclone.  It started working shortly after that.   Windows/ibm had a windows fix pushed Thursday or Friday.   Ratnakar also had me run 'make all' before running 'make node-sdk-unit-tests' so that is what I do  now.  I don't need to run 'make node-sdk' on its own
but what happen if don't run ' make all'  before?
It so happens I just started my vagrant .. I'll try that now!
I mean, on a mac/linux host you can call directly ' mac node-sdk'  without issues

<@U0ZR63HLK>: jumping in cold, so I might be missing some context here, but note there was a recent bug fix where “make node-sdk-unit-test” didnt fully express its dependencies and thus the “make all” was a workaround
but that should be fixed now such that the workaround is no longer required
Yes, <@U0ZR63HLK> <@U0KPFAZNF>, I was able to run 'make node-sdk-unit-tests' without running make all first
